H0.text: The speed of the particles decreases as liquid nitrous oxide is cooled to its freezing point of –91 °C.

H1.text: The particles begin to move in a straight line as liquid nitrous oxide is cooled to its freezing point of –91 °C.

H2.text: The particles begin to move with a greater force as the temperature of liquid nitrous oxide is lowered to its freezing point of –91 °C.

H3.text: The motion of the particles becomes more random as the temperature of liquid nitrous oxide is lowered to its freezing point of –91 °C.

A4.text: Heat or temperature is a manifestation of atoms and molecules in constant agitation.
